column4: sorry I need to ask again... but: where does the installer grab the hostname for the network configuration stage of install.
/etc/hostname  ?
or /etc/dhcp3/dhcpd.conf
during a fresh install?
install from CD?
yeah, the alt iso.
wouldn't there be a moment during the install, where it prompts you for the hostname?
right. where does that name come from, when it self populates?
i'm guessing from the CD. never checked, but it probably has a default hostname file on CD, where the hostname defaults to "ubuntu:
that was my expectation but I asked because I've tried a few fresh installs and each time the installer finds my previous hostname. Even after I dd'd my hard drives from sec 0 to sec max.
are u connected to a dhcp server?
yeah, and that nic does have a reserved ip. Could it be grabbing the info because that's the name associated with the mac on the dhcp server?
yes. check /etc/dhcp3/dhcpd.conf and find your hostname in there, along with the mac addr and reserved IP

well I don't have such an animal during the fresh install, but at least you've helped my peace-of-mind. I'd spent a good amount of time fighting problems with fakeraid+ LVM and that seemed like yet another problem to fix...
something like: host mustanggsbox { hardware ethernet 00:d3:24:f7:82 ; fixed-address 192.168.20.3 ; }
you could try deleting that entry from your dhcpd.conf, then restart dhcp3-server before installing again
my dhcp box is a linux router.
so I guess I'd mistaken assumed (!) that I would be able to find info on this in faq/docs or whereever. :)
i see
u could also check #ubuntu-server for more info on this subject
thank you for the info. I  think I will do just that when I have a chance.
u're welcome :-)
